definition: to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)

sentences.english: We must work hard to raise to a new level the military and political quality of our army.
sentences.chinese: 要奋发图强，把我军的军政素质提高到一个新的水平。

sentences.english: CHINA, forgingahead as a future world leader.
sentences.chinese: 中国，作为未来的世界领袖而奋发进取。

sentences.english: My whole body is a kind of spirit that inspired upwards.
sentences.chinese: 我的整个身心被一种奋发向上的精神鼓舞着。

sentences.english: We all can gradually learn to become worthies and sages ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 只要奋发向上，人人都可以渐渐达到圣贤的境界。

sentences.english: In my experience, I have found that the arriver has greater problems than the striver .
sentences.chinese: 依照我的经验，成功者比奋发者面临的难题更棘手。

sentences.english: Wang Fenfa saw his mother angry and drink water.
sentences.chinese: 王奋发见母亲发了火，便喝水。

sentences.english: Here, you can find a bads mell, make progress together.
sentences.chinese: 在这里，你能找到一股一起奋发前进旳气味。

sentences.english: Subjectiveness of cognition lays the foundation for diligent and ambitious people.
sentences.chinese: 认识的主体性为奋发有为的人生奠定理论基础。

sentences.english: As for the wave is mediocre, and hard work is wise move.
sentences.chinese: 碌碌无为是庸人所为，奋发图强是智者之举。

sentences.english: For all pain helps to make us rise.
sentences.chinese: 一切痛苦都有助于我们奋发向上。

sentences.english: We must seize opportunities, cope with challenges together, get rid of interference and forge ahead.
sentences.chinese: 必须抓住机遇，共迎挑战，排除干扰，奋发进取。

sentences.english: I wish I were this eagle, for he struggled to achieve and take pride.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望自己就是这奋发向上并以此为傲的鹰。

sentences.english: Wen encourages Chinese youths on Youth Day eve.
sentences.chinese: 温家宝在五四青年节前夕鼓励学生奋发向上。

sentences.english: Did it motivate or demotivate you?
sentences.chinese: 那将激励你奋发图强还是让你变得消极厌世呢？

sentences.english: Read good books, do to make progress.
sentences.chinese: 读健康有益之书，做奋发向上之人。

definition: to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to make an effort/to push for sth/to work hard
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
